title.narrative: 3.2. MONITOR INCLUSIVE PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, the national, regional and priority local governments will have built their capacities to monitor the management of inclusive, quality and relevant primary-education policies for indigenous, rural and peri-urban children., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children exposed to concerns related to gender, ethnicity, area of residence, living conditions or differences in skills will live in safe environments and have full access to relevant and quality registration, health, nutrition, care, education, water, sanitation and hygiene services that promote their full development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the national, regional and priority local governments will have built their capacities to monitor the management of inclusive, quality and relevant primary-education policies for indigenous, rural and peri-urban children.

description.narrative: The monitoring system of the Intercultural Bilingual Education (IBE) Policy has been designed and the Rural Education Policy has started to be implemented with UNICEF technical support. Education is becoming more inclusive of children with disabilities with new approaches and tools - for primary school teachers at validation stage. UNICEF has promoted the participation of civil society and adolescents in consultations geared at drafting the National Education Project 2036 (PEN 2036). UNICEF has contributed to the elimination of administrative barriers to access education for migrant children, benefiting 75,000 children, including 60,000 in initial and primary education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of teachers trained to provide distance support to learners with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of educational equity policies recommendations for participation institutional spaces (CNE, COPARE and COPALES) by civil society, in the priority areas.
System Strengthening - Multilingual Ed. - National policy environment supports mother tongue/multilingual education - score (1-4), see guidance
Budget of the education sector assigned to priority areas (IBE, inclusive education).

target.value: 2021:Budget remain or increases (compared to last year)

actual.value:
2019:Budget allocated to budget lines related to IBE: S/ 170,114,995
Budget allocated to budget lines related to Inclusive Education: S/ 198,361,187
At the end of 2018, the levels were S/.186,595,053 and S/.199,361,111 respectively, which accounts for a reduction of 9% and 1% respectively. In IBE

title.narrative: Level of progress in the implementation of the policy and national plan of IBE.

target.value: 2021:Level 4 (Monitoring of policy and plan disseminated and incorporated into annual management guidelines such as the pre-school directive and other equivalents)

actual.value: 2019:Level 3: The IBE Policy and Plan Monitoring System has been completed with technical assistance from UNICEF and is being used for the management and implementation of activities.

title.narrative: The country has systems of regular (annual) monitoring of progress in Intercultural Bilingual Education, Rural Education, and Inclusive Education, whose results are publicly disseminated.

baseline.value: Score 1 Annual information produced by Ministry of Education (MINEDU) for at least 2 of the 3 identified areas (Intercultural Bilingual Education, Rural Education and Inclusive Education)

target.value: 2021:Score 5 Annual information produced by Ministry of Education (MINEDU) includes monitoring of equity, budget and specific plans for the 3 identified areas; And is used for educational policy decision making

actual.value: 2019:Score 2: current development of the IBE Policy makes it possible to monitor equity and budget, and eventually the IBE Plan; new Rural Education Policy will produce annual information and UNICEF is supporting MoE in monitoring gaps and budget.

title.narrative: Degree of development of undergraduate teacher training programmes in IBE and pre-school level, to scattered and rural areas.

baseline.value: Score 1 There are training programs in intercultural bilingual education for preschool or primary, specifically aimed at improving performance in rural or scattered areas of intervention regions.

target.value: 2021:Score 3 There are training programs in intercultural bilingual education for preschool and primary, specifically aimed at improving performance in rural and scattered areas of intervention regions.

actual.value: 2019:Score 2: There are IBE training programmes in Loreto, Ucayali and Huancavelica, but they need to improve their training offer. UNICEF has provided technical assistance to MoE for the revision and validation of new curriculum for pre-service teacher training for pre-school and primary school educatio
